node.title: Justine’s Ruszczyk’s family says killer cop’s reduced sentence not enough for ‘obscene’ shooting
node.description: This is how an Australian family challenged a US policing system and its use of brutal force. But for Justine’s Ruszczyk's family there is more to be done to ensure their daughter’s "obscene" death was not in vain.
node.content:
["The videos of Justine Ruszczyk's death were played over and over in the Minneapolis courtroom. It was agony for her family.", "The police body cam vision meant they were reliving the last moments of her life. They had come from Australia to bear witness.", "They wanted the people in the courtroom to know that she was a vibrant person; that she was loved; a daughter, a sister, and not just a body on the ground.", "But it came, says her father John Ruszczyk, at \"a terrible cost\".", "\"It was utterly terrible and utterly awful,\" he tells Australian Story.", "", "
Justine with her stepmother Maryan and father John.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "They stayed in the courtroom and watched, says her stepmother Maryan Heffernan, because: \"We couldn't leave her there alone. It was important that we were there for her.", "\"We couldn't have all these details brought out without being present.\"", "", "
John has been back to the US several times, including the day Noor was originally sentenced to 12 years prison in 2019.(Reuters: Craig Lassig)
", "Justine's family has been relentless in their quest for justice. They are determined not to let their daughter's death be in vain.", "\"There's a lot more people who are pushing for change, stemming from Justine and stemming from George Floyd,\" Maryan says.", "\"Hopefully that's, you know, reached a tipping point where there will be change.\"", "But the Ruszczyk family was devastated when the\u00a0Minnesota Supreme Court overturned Mohamed Noor's murder conviction and last month re-sentenced him to five years for manslaughter. He is expected to walk free in June next year.", "\"The prosecution team was surprised, they were taken aback,\" John says.", "\"I really didn't think it would happen.", "\"If the community wants the police held accountable, the government has to provide them laws on which to prosecute officers who commit crimes.\"", "
Police officers\u00a0'spooked',\u00a0fired fatal shot
", "On the hot summer night of July 15, 2017, Justine could not have been happier or in a better place in her life.", "Only weeks away from getting married in Hawaii, she was texting a friend about bridesmaid dresses and working at a desk surrounded by photographs of her Australian home.", "She had found a like-minded spiritual community in a peaceful, picturesque suburb of Minneapolis,\u00a0with tree-lined streets and a welcoming community.", "", "
Justine was living happily in Minneapolis with her fiance Don and stepson Zac.(Facebook: Don Miller Damond)
", "Just before 11:30pm, she heard what she thought was a sexual assault outside. She phoned her fiance Don Damond, who was away working in Las Vegas, and he told her to call 911.", "", "
Justine died within minutes of being shot not far from her home.(Australian Story: Greg Nelson)
", "When the squad car came down the lane, she went out and approached the police. Her father wonders if\u00a0she wanted to tell them they had gone past the place of the sexual assault.", "Officer Matthew Harrity was in the drivers' seat but did not fire. \"We both got spooked\", he later told a supervisor. But Mohamed Noor drew his gun and fired across his partner, striking the barefoot Justine in the abdomen.", "She died minutes later on the pavement, around the corner from her home.", "", "
Noor (left)\u00a0had trained to become a police officer in a mid-career switch.(AP: Star Tribune/David Joles)
", "
'Anybody can be shot'
", "For decades the Minneapolis Police Department has had a reputation for acting with impunity.", "In 2015, two years before Justine Ruszczyk's\u00a0death, the Washington Post newspaper began logging every fatal shooting by an on-duty police officer in the United States. Since then, it's reported more than 5,000 deaths.", "Some of the most high-profile deaths have been in Minneapolis.", "The African American community continues to live\u00a0in fear of the police.", "Minneapolis residents had been outraged when\u00a0Philando Castile was shot dead a year before Justine's death after a routine traffic stop. His partner live-streamed his death\u00a0on Facebook. When Justine was killed after calling 911 it sparked more community protests.", "", "
Neighbours expressed their disbelief at the senseless killing, launching the Justice for Justine campaign.(AP: Jeff Wheeler/Star Tribune)
", "A vigil in Justine's memory was held at the site of her death. Hundreds marched in her memory. Mourners attended a memorial service and a silent walk around Lake Harriet close to her home.", "The family's US lawyer Robert\u00a0Bennett gives an ominous warning: \"If she can be shot, anybody can be shot. Any 911 caller, any mother in her pyjamas.\"", "", "
Valerie Castile, mother of Philando Castile who was killed by police, joins in the march for Justice for Justine.(AFP/Getty Images: Stephen Maturen)
", "
Short-lived justice as police officer charged
", "Justine had been a person of peace. She wanted to help people.", "She had grown up on Sydney's Northern Beaches. An animal lover, she\u00a0graduated from veterinary science with honours, but then took a spiritual path.", "\"She wanted to save people from hurt and pain,\" her stepmother Maryan says.", "\u00a0In 2012 Justine met Don Damond at a meditation retreat in Colorado Springs.", "\"The connection that I felt was beyond anything I've ever experienced,\" he told Australian Story just months after the shooting. She had moved to Minneapolis to be with him.", "For Justine's grieving family, the next four years would be \"hell\". They hadn't known if Noor would be charged over the shooting. It would almost be unprecedented for a police officer to be convicted.", "", "
John questions whether Noor's manslaughter charge and reduced sentence fits the crime.(Australian Story\u00a0)
", "\"We were in the dark for a very long time,\" John Ruszczyk says. \"It was very frustrating for us as a family to be over here and not knowing if the man who killed Justine was going to stand trial.\"", "More than 14,000 kilometres away they would be taking calls from Minneapolis at 3:00am.", "On March 20, 2018, Noor was charged with third-degree murder, second-degree murder and manslaughter.", "\"We were happy as a family; we were happy for the citizens of Minneapolis that a cop was going to be held accountable for his actions,\" John says.\u00a0\"It was justice for Justine.\"", "
What's a human life worth?
", "By now it was an international news story. The entire Minneapolis Police Department was on trial.", "Noor's defence was that he felt he had driven into an ambush and that he had heard a loud slap on the car. Neither he nor his partner Matthew Harrity had their body cameras on and the car was taken to the car wash a short time later. Any evidence was washed away.", "\"They allowed the Minneapolis Police Department to take possession of the automobile from which she was shot and take it to a car wash and detail it, rather than keep it for evidence,\" Robert Bennett says.", "\"I don't believe, nor does the prosecution believe there was ever a bang\u00a0on the squad [car]. They had plenty of time to cook that up which we believe they did.\"", "John believes the police were protecting their own and covering up. Noting comments \u00a0from the jury post-trial John says they\u00a0were \"incredulous with the information that came out in the trial\".", "\"Noor's fellow police officers were capable of impeding the investigation, were willing to distort the truth, to lie. I think of them as a guild where you enter this secret society and swear loyalty above all to your fellow guild members.\"\u00a0", "", "
Former police officer Mohamed Noor at his trial.(ABC News: Niall Lenihan)
", "There was an excruciating five-hour wait while the jury deliberated the verdict.", "\"We were just utterly anxious, nervous,\" Maryan recalls. And then the jury came in.", "\"First charge of second-degree murder was not guilty. So, we had to hold our breath,\" John says.", "\"Then she read the next charge third-degree murder, guilty, manslaughter, guilty.\"", "Supporters outside were overcome with emotion.", "\"His conviction was the first murder conviction of a police officer, I think nationwide,\" Robert\u00a0Bennett says.", "\"I've been practising 45 years and\u00a0you just don't see those kinds of convictions.\"", "Noor was sentenced to 12-and-a-half years'\u00a0prison.", "\"We felt satisfied that justice had been done,\" Maryan says.", "Soon after Noor's conviction, Justine's family settled a civil case against the City of Minneapolis, achieving a record compensation payout of $20 million.", "\u201cWe wanted to set a new benchmark for what a human life is worth,\u201d John says.", "The New York Times reported it was the largest such settlement in the history of the US.", "\"It was hoped that it would deter further activities,\" Mr Bennett says.", "But it didn't.", "", "
Robert Bennett says the intitial murder conviction of Noor was unprecedented in Minnesota.(Australian Story: Greg Nelson)
", "
Justine's death 'an obscenity'
", "In May last year, George Floyd was killed by Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin. The country exploded with anger.", "\"Nothing's changed,\" Justine's stepmother Maryan says.\u00a0", "", "
Protesters take over Minneapolis police precinct(Courtesy: Sophie Narwitz)
", "This year, Mohamed Noor appealed his third-degree murder conviction in the Minnesota Court of Appeals. A panel of judges denied the appeal.", "But in a bitter twist, the Minnesota Supreme Court overturned Noor's murder conviction in September.", "He was re-sentenced for manslaughter last month, reducing his 12 -and-a-half-year sentence to five\u00a0years.", "It was the second time the family had to experience the distress for what the family called \"the utterly gratuitous murder of Justine\u201d.", "The decision devastated Justine's family.", "John says the manner in which Justine was killed \"was an obscenity\" and unacceptable in a civil society. \"A police officer has to be held accountable and to pay the penalty,\"\u00a0he says.", "", "
Noor listens to victim impact statements during his re-sentencing last month.(AAP: Minneapolis Star-Tribune\u00a0Leila Navidi)
", "Justine Ruszczyk and her family's four-year fight for justice will not be forgotten in the city of Minneapolis. For her family, says her stepmother, it has been \"an emotional roller coaster\".", "\"We will leave it to the Minneapolis community to make change,\" John says back home in Sydney.", "\"I think there's enough angry people in the community to make that change.\"", "", "
Justine's death was felt on both sides of the world. People gathered at Lake Harriet near Justine's home in the US for a memorial service.(AP: Aaron Lavinsky/Star Tribune)
", "Watch Australian Story's Justice for Justine 8:00pm (AEDT) on ABCTV, iview and Youtube."]
